alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 2:30AM PST until January 11 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 1 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada, including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit, and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...From 4 AM early this morning to 1 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with travel delays from chain controls, reduced visibility with whiteout conditions at times, snow covered roads and possible road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels lowering to 2500 to 3500 feet Wednesday. Heaviest amounts expected above 4000 feet. Snow rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour in the afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
